moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Bc4 Nxe4 4. Nc3 N: All the tournament games begin here, with White to move.
moves.9. fxg6 hxg6 10. Qg4 g5 11. Nf5: Instead of a mere retreat to safety, I aggressively counter, planting the Knight on a great square and attacking the Black Q.
moves.11... Qg6 12. Be3 d6 13. Bd3 Bxf5 14. Bx: Black chooses to exchange minor pieces.
moves.14... Qh5 15. Qa4+ Nc6 16. Be4: Threatening 17 BxN ch PxB 18 QxP ch winning Black's QR.
moves.19... g4+ 20. Ke2 Bh6 21. Bxc6+: This move wins a whole Rook in addition to removing a pair of minor pieces.
moves.21... Ke7 22. Bxa8 Rxa8 23. Bxh6: I swap off the game's final minors.
moves.23... Qxh6 24. Qxb5: May as well take the loose Pawn.
moves.24... Qg6 25. Qd3: Threatening to swap off the Queens.
moves.25... Qh5 26. g3: Securing my own King's position against an invasion.
moves.27... Qg2+ 28. Kd1: Black's unsupported Q can do nothing useful.
moves.28... Rh8 29. Qf5: Threatening 30 QxP ch winning Black's remaining Rook.
moves.31... Kd7 32. Qf7+: Forcing the desired exchange of Queens.
moves.34... c5 35. c4: Sealing the escape route. Black has only one move to avoid an immediate mate...
